incidents.name: Issue Regarding Auto-Recharge

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the Twilio Console issue regarding auto-recharges, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.
We've become aware of a potential issue with the Twilio Console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Errors Impacting Multiple Twilio Services

incident_updates.body: All services impacted have recovered and are operating as intended. This incident has been resolved.

We continue to observe recovery in the previously reported Twilio services. Were making a correction to our previous communications regarding Flex insights impact. After investigation, we could confirm that Flex Insights wasnt impacted, but Flex Historical Insights. Thus, Historical data reports for Flex Historical Insights that are currently unavailable during the Twilio impacted services may take some time to be available. We will be monitoring all services to ensure a full recovery and provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing recovery in the previously reported Twilio services. Historical data reports for Flex Historical Insights that are currently unavailable during the Twilio impacted services may take some time to be available. We will be monitoring all services to ensure a full recovery and provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing recovery in the previously reported Twilio services. We will be monitoring all services to ensure a full recovery and provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineering team identified an issue with Flex Insights that is affecting users being unable to sign in to insights, and data being delayed for those that are already logged in. Customers may also experience issues updating existing functions and assets. Customers may see 500 errors when sign up for TOTP within their accounts. Furthermore, customers are unable to register for WhatsApp and the Authy Desktop App is unable to be dowloaded at the moment. Our engineers are actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

For customer support assistance, please log in to your Twilio console, and submit a support ticket. Customers may be unable to create support tickets via Sendgrid. Check SendGrids status page for more details.

Our engineering team identified an issue with Flex Insights that is affecting users being unable to sign in to insights, and data being delayed for those that are already logged in. Customers may experience issues updating existing assets. Customers may see 500 errors in the Twilio console, and not being able to sign up for TOTP. Our engineers are actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

For customer support assistance, please log in to your Twilio or Twilio SendGrid account and submit a support ticket.

We are experiencing an issue with the Flex Insights and Functions services. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating errors impacting multiple Twilio services. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

If you're having issues to contact support. For customer support assistance, please log in to your Twilio or Twilio SendGrid account and submit a support ticket.

You can check the status of this at https://status.twilio.com/incidents/mpbb7pfh2rvw.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Voice Intelligence. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 17% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: The 17% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped has been resolved, and Super SIM is operating normally at this time.

The 17% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at [22:10 UTC], we observed 17% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. After the initial drop we detected two additional session drops after the system has partially recovered. We are still missing ~17% of sessions. We are actively working to identify and resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Beginning at [22:10 UTC], we observed 17% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. We observe that some of the devices have recovered. We are actively working to identify and resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Errors on some Twilio URLs

incident_updates.body: Some Twilio URLs were degraded for 6 days, 21 hours and 52 minutes between 12:47 on 06/05/2023 and 10:39 on 06/12/2023 Pacific Time. During this time, customer may face intermitted issues reaching some Twilio pages. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues in APAC Region

incident_updates.body: Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region. We are continuing to investigate the source of the data connectivity issue with our carrier partners. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region. We are continuing to investigate the source of the data connectivity issue with our carrier partners. We will provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to there being no issue with the signaling events that establish the connection between the device and the cellular networks, impacted devices connecting with Super SIM most likely will not end up in the Limited Service state required for the multi-IMSI failover process to occur. Moreover, due to the small percentage of devices identified that may be impacted, we will not be blocking connections on the impacted IMSIs across all Super SIMs to force devices into Limited Service to facilitate the IMSI failover. However, if you believe you are being actively impacted by this incident, please contact Twilio customer support to discuss account-specific changes we can put in place to help get your devices reconnected.We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to there being no issue with the signaling events that establish the connection between the device and the cellular networks, impacted devices connecting with Super SIM most likely will not end up in the Limited Service state required for the multi-IMSI failover process to occur. Moreover, due to the small percentage of devices identified that may be impacted, we will not be blocking connections on the impacted IMSIs across all Super SIMs to force devices into Limited Service to facilitate the IMSI failover. However, if you believe you are being actively impacted by this incident, please contact Twilio customer support to discuss account-specific changes we can put in place to help get your devices reconnected.We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to there being no issue with the signaling events that establish the connection between the device and the cellular networks, impacted devices connecting with Super SIM most likely will not end up in the Limited Service state required for the multi-IMSI failover process to occur. Moreover, due to the small percentage of devices identified that may be impacted, we will not be blocking connections on the impacted IMSIs across all Super SIMs to force devices into Limited Service to facilitate the IMSI failover. However, if you believe you are being actively impacted by this incident, please contact Twilio customer support to discuss account-specific changes we can put in place to help get your devices reconnected.

We are investigating connectivity issues when using the 'sg1.super' APN with some Super SIM IMSIs. To be impacted, devices would need to both be configured to use the 'sg1.super' APN and be using one of the impacted IMSIs to connect to the cellular networks. The 'sg1.super' APN directs Super SIM traffic to our distributed internet breakout location in Singapore. Assuming that only devices deployed in APAC or Oceania regions would be configured to the use the 'sg1.super' APN to benefit from the lower latency offered by a closer breakout location, the countries with devices most likely to be impacted are Australia, Singapore, India, and the United Arab Emirates. For other countries throughout APAC and Oceania, other, non-impacted IMSIs are preferred. However, devices deployed elsewhere in the world that are configured to use the 'sg1.super' APN may be impacted if the impacted IMSIs are preferred in those countries. If you believe you have been impacted and are able to change the APN on your devices, you can set the APN to 'super' and your data will breakout in Virginia, USA.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues in APAC Region. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 12:05 Pacific time, we observed ~2% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. incidents.name: SMS Delivery Failures to Chile Entel and Telefonica Network From Chile Phone Numbers

incidents.name: Errors for Console and API Requests

incident_updates.body: Twilio Console, API, TaskRouter, and Debugger were degraded for 4 minutes between 06:41 and 06:44 Pacific Time on 06/07/2023. During this period of time, customers may have experienced 5XX errors for multiple API endpoints and the console. Customers were not able to make/receive calls on Flex. Webhooks for debug events were not received either. The issue has now been resolved.
